Node.jsÂ® is a free, open-source, cross-platform JavaScript runtime environment that lets developers create servers, web apps, command line tools and scripts.
Download Node.js(LTS)

Node.js can also be installed via version managers.
  • Create a HTTP server
  • Write Tests
  • Read and Hash a file
  • Streams Pipeline
  • Works with Threads
import { createServer } from 'node:http'; const server = createServer((req, res) => { res.writeHead(200, { 'Content-Type': 'text/plain' }); res.end('Hello World!\n'); }); // starts a simple http server locally on port 3000 server.listen(3000, '127.0.0.1', () => { console.log('Listening on 127.0.0.1:3000'); });
